text.0: from you two came the gifts in days aforetime which trasadasyu granted to the pūrus.
text.1: ye gave the winner of our fields and ploughlands and the strong smiter who subdued the dasyus.
text.2: and ye gave mighty dadhikrās the giver of many gifts who visiteth all people.
text.3: impetuous hawk swift and of varied colour like a brave king whom each true man must honour.
text.4: whom as twere down a precipice swift rushing each pūru praises and his heart rejoices.
text.5: springing forth like a hero fain for battle whirling the car and flying like the tempest.
text.6: who gaineth precious booty in the combats and moveth winning spoil among the cattle.
text.7: shown in bright colour looking on the assemblies beyond the churl to worship of the living.
text.8: loudly the folk cry after him in battles as twere a thief who steals away a garment.
text.9: speeding to glory or a herd of cattle even as a hungry falcon swooping downward.
text.10: and fain to come forth first amid these armies this way and that with rows of cars he rushes.
text.11: gay like a bridesman making him a garland tossing the dust champing the rein that holds him.
text.12: and that strong steed victorious and faithful obedient with his body in the combat.
text.13: speeding straight on amid the swiftly pressing casts oer his brows the dust he tosses upward.
text.14: and at his thunder like the roar of heaven those who attack tremble and are affrighted.
text.15: for when he fights against embattled thousands dread is he in his striving none may stay him.
text.16: the people praise the overpowering swiftness of this fleet steed who giveth men abundance.
text.17: of him they say when drawing back from battle dadhikrās hath sped forward with his thousands.
text.18: dadhikrās hath oerspread the fivefold people with vigour as the sun lightens the waters.
text.19: may the strong steed who winneth hundreds thousands requite with sweetness these my words and praises.
